ygData.subject: Running Heritrix from the command line
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I m running heritrix from the command line, like tgeorgio. I can start a crawl and watch the progress-statistics.log file to see its progress. What is the

Subject: Running Heritrix from the command line
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=10485251; y=Naax3j4MGhTPA0WAnAn5_8PYrdA6lD_VKmkKthMpUhayaKPcqj9kCydXsZM
X-Yahoo-Profile: helvella_lacunosa

Hi,

I'm running heritrix from the command line, like tgeorgio.

I can start a crawl and watch the progress-statistics.log file to see
its progress.

What is the expected behavior when the crawl is done? I'm seeing the
heritrix keep running, updating the progress-statistics.log with lines
that indicate no activity. I would have hoped that the process would
end when the crawl is done.

What is the proper way to end the heritrix process with no web ui?
Is it ok to just kill the process?

I'd like to control crawls with some shell scripts.

Thanks,
-Colin.

p.s. I'm still on 1.12.1, to take advantage of the dedupe-plugin.


On Tue, May 13, 2008 at 05:17:38AM -0000, tgeorgio wrote:
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "tgeorgio"
> <tristen_georgiou@...> wrote:
> >
> > Hi all,
> > 
> > I've run crawls successfully through the web UI fine, but when I try
> > to run an order from the command line, I can't get it to work. I
> > copied the order and the seeds file from a crawl that ran fine in the
> > UI, and modified the seeds file, crawl name, and other order params.
> > 
> > I then try to run the crawl from the command line like this:
> > 
> > $HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix --nowui --admin=admin:letmein order.xml
> > 
> > The result is the help screen dump and no error...is there a crucial
> > step or argument I am missing or have incorrect?
> > 
> > Thanks,
> > 
> > Tristen
> >
> 
> Figured it out...put the user password string into the heritrix
> properties file (in the conf dir) and the just run it like this:
> 
> $HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix --nowui order.xml
>
